description:
The Cloud Architect will be responsible for designing, governing, and optimizing complex cloud architectures in alignment with organizational strategy and vision. This role demands advanced technical expertise, significant cross-functional leadership abilities, and deep customer engagement skills.

RESPONSIBILITIES:
• Architect, design, and govern comprehensive cloud solutions, acting as the pinnacle of technical leadership.
• Lead strategic AWS initiatives, including Landing Zone buildouts, complex migrations, and large-scale architectural reviews.
• Engage with executive stakeholders and technical teams to translate business needs into technology strategy.
• Develop and present architectural blueprints, roadmaps, and governance structures.
• Mentor and delegate tasks to engineering teams, ensuring adherence to best practices.
• Maintain a proactive focus on advancing security measures across all cloud operations.
• Act as the primary consultant for cloud strategy, working with both technical and non-technical audiences.

QUALIFICATIONS:
• Minimum of 10 years in technology Operations or Professional Services, with a focus on cloud computing, software development, or systems engineering.
• Demonstrated Subject Matter Expertise (SME) in one or more core capabilities.
• 5 years of infrastructure architecture, database architecture, and networking experience.
• Ability to lead advanced Well-Architected Reviews (WARs) as the Primary Engineer, with a minimum of 3 years in design, implementation, or consulting in applications and infrastructures.
• Advanced proficiency in AWS services, including compute, networking, storage, and database.
• Comprehensive experience in Infrastructure as Code (IaC) deployment and configuration.
• Skilled in DevOps, Orchestration/Configuration Management, and Continuous Integration, with proficiency in at least three relevant technologies (e.g., Chef, Puppet, Docker, Jenkins, Ansible).
• Familiarity with at least two version control platforms (e.g., Git, Perforce, SVN).
• Advanced system administration skills for both Windows and Linux environments.
• Networking expertise, including advanced troubleshooting (TCP/IP, DNS, LAN/WAN).
• Deep understanding of virtualization and cloud computing concepts (e.g., Hypervisors, VMware, Xen).
• Experience managing full application stacks.
• Proficiency in communicating across various stakeholder groups, including executive levels.
• Experience with end-user or developer community engagement.
• Adherence to AWS and security best practices.

COMPUTER SKILLS:
• Expertise in AWS compute, networking, storage, and database services.
• Advanced proficiency in multiple DevOps and CI/CD tools such as Chef, Puppet, Docker, Jenkins, and Ansible.
• Skilled in at least two version control systems, including but not limited to Git, Perforce, SVN.
• Advanced system administration skills for both Windows and Linux platforms.
• Comprehensive understanding of networking protocols and advanced troubleshooting techniques (TCP/IP, DNS, LAN/WAN).

CERTIFICATIONS:
• AWS Cloud Practitioner
• AWS Solutions Architect Associate
• AWS SysOps Administrator Associate
• AWS Developer Associate
• AWS Solutions Architect Professional
• One or more AWS Professional or Specialty certifications (in addition to SA Pro)
• Commitment to continuous learning through activities like reading technical documentation and participating in webinars.

TRAVEL REQUIREMENTS:

Expected travel is approximately 10-15% of the year.
